title: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. household spending bounced back in June, but the upswing in Covid-19 cases related to the Delta variant is injecting uncertainty into the economic outlook.

---

Big oil companies are raking in their highest profits since the onset of the pandemic, but they plan to continue spending sparingly to boost production.

---

Robinhood's bid to revolutionize IPOs has created losses for investors instead, after the company's highly anticipated listing fell flat.

---

U.S. stocks fell, but the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq all posted gains for July.

---

Procter & Gamble gave a somber outlook for the year ahead, predicting slower sales and higher costs.

---

Amazon was fined about $887 million by an EU privacy regulator for violations related to its advertising.

---

Music publisher Primary Wave has acquired the largest stake in the estate of the late pop star Prince.
